Name: Standing Statue of Inty Shedu
Description: The statue depicts Inty Shedu standing with his left leg forward. He wears a short wig painted black that hides his ears, a broad blue and white collar of three rows, and a short kilt. His hands are stretched the length of his body and his right hand holds a roll of linen or leather, a sign of authority. The statue is supported by a back pillar. On the base, hieroglyphic signs give his names and titles.
